title: The 11 Best U.S. Beaches That Stay Warm All Year Round
text: Do you ever crave a deliciously warm beach on a cold winter day? If you want to escape the cold and go to a place where the weather is a nice 65 degrees, then look no further than the beaches on this list. These U.S. beaches stay warm all year round. It means you can tan, have some fun in the fun, and do water activities any time of the year. It’s the perfect winter holiday for you to take. Let’s explore the 11 best U.S. beaches that stay warm all year round. The oldest city in California is San Diego, which the Spanish founded several centuries before California became a state. ©Unwind/Shutterstock.com San Diego is the ultimate destination if you like warm weather and amazing beaches. There are a myriad of beaches that you can enjoy for the entire family or just for you and your partner. From Coronado to La Jolla, there are many options. If you like a little more relaxed atmosphere, you can go to Coronado or La Jolla. If you want a little more action and to have fun, there is always Mission Beach, Ocean Beach, or Pacific Beach. The weather in San Diego is always absolutely amazing. That’s why it’s known to be America’s Finest City. The best part is, if you want to escape the beach you can always go for several hikes in many well-known spots throughout the county or go to the world-famous zoo . Gianni Versace was assassinated outside his home in Miami, FL. ©fokke baarssen/Shutterstock.com Having fun under the sun is just one part of your vacation if you go to Miami. Its white sandy beaches are pristine and packed with people throughout the entire year. If you go walking down Ocean Drive, you’ll see the numerous Art Deco buildings that are famous. There are many clubs and restaurants throughout Miami Beach. It’s one of the most photographed and filmed cities in the world. With Florida’s warm weather, Miami ends up being one of the most sought-after places to vacation during winter. If you want to escape the beach, you can always tour around many of the buildings in the Miami Art Deco District including fashion designer Gianni Versace’s mansion. Oahu is the site of Pearl Harbor, which is the military base bombed during World War II. ©SCStock/Shutterstock.com The ultimate tropical vacation is located in Hawaii. You get warm weather all year round, amazing beaches for you to frolic in, and gorgeous views that will leave you stunned. Oahu is great for families and couples. It’s home to Waikiki Beach , the world-famous beach that has attracted people from all over the world. Head out into the ocean and you can surf till sunset. Afterward, you can head to a luau for a delicious feast and a show. is a television series that took place in Laguna Beach. ©Juancat/Shutterstock.com Laguna Beach is famous for its pristine beaches that people from all over Southern California frequent. With sunshine and warm weather all year round, it’s perfect for you to go on a little winter escapade. Temperatures never go below 60 degrees during winter. The best part is that if you want to do something more than just lay under the sun, there are many chic shops, delicious restaurants, and cool bars for everyone’s fancy. You can hike up the canyons that are close by for great views of the Pacific Ocean. Myrtle Beach has an average annual temperature of 62 degrees Fahrenheit. ©Sean Pavone/ via Getty Images Just imagine 60 miles of beach and golf courses by the Atlantic Ocean. That’s what you’ll get in Myrtle Beach. You can lay out and tan under the sun, frolic in the water, and even go do water activities in the Atlantic. Everything is at your fingertips. If you want to do something different, you can walk on the boardwalk and play games. You can also go on the SkyWheel, which is one of the nation’s tallest Ferris wheels. Key Largo, FL has an average yearly temperature of about 77 degrees Fahrenheit. ©iStock.com/lucky-photographer If you’re looking for a more adventure-style vacation, look no further than Key Largo, FL . It is considered the Dive Capital of the World, which means you can have fun snorkeling through the world’s largest artificial reef. You can also check out some old Spanish shipwrecks. Some of the fish you will be able to spot here are barracuda and parrotfish, among others. Besides laying under the sun and enjoying the beach, the Everglades is also nearby. Key Largo is located between Key West and Miami, which means you will also enjoy the ocean surrounding you. Kauai is known as the Garden Isle because it has a more tropical feel to the island than the others. ©Shane Myers Photography/Shutterstock.com Although Kauai is less known than Oahu, it has a tropical rainforest that has attracted tourists from everywhere. The weather is amazing all year round, so you don’t have to worry about being cold during your trip there. You can lounge around at the beach and not get annoyed by the multitude of people. It’s more secluded than other islands in Hawaii. If you want to do more nature-oriented activities, you can always go on hikes through the rainforest. LA is home to Hollywood, the entertainment capital of the world. ©trekandshoot/iStock via Getty Images Los Angeles is a big county. And there’s so much to do. That’s why it’s the entertainment capital of the world because it’s home to so many celebrities. When it comes to beaches, you will enjoy every second of your time under the sun. There are also a myriad of beaches that you can go to. From enjoying the attractions and games in Santa Monica to frolicking with the stars in Malibu . LA has it all. If you get tired of the beach, you can always head east and dine at amazing restaurants in West Hollywood, tour around Beverly Hills and see if you can spot any stars, or even check out Hollywood. The temperatures in South Padre Island are great year-round with the average being 74 degrees Fahrenheit. ©ruthannburke/iStock via Getty Images Located in southern Texas on a barrier island, South Padre Island is famous for its beaches and the nature center that is home to many migrating birds. While you are on this island, you’re going to feel like you are in a tropical oasis. It’s 34 miles of fantastic beaches — white sand and beautiful, crystal-clear water. After you’ve spent your day at the beach, you can always go bird watching to see the migrating birds . You can also spend some time with dolphins at the South Padre Dolphin Research and Sealife Nature Center. St. Simons Island is home to beautiful birds like gannets and spoonbills. ©iStock.com/DorothyBlahnik Located off the coast of Georgia, St. Simons Island is a beautiful place filled with white sand and salt marshes. St. Simons Island also offers visitors a little history lesson because there is a lighthouse that was rebuilt in 1872. After all, it was destroyed during the Civil War. Besides enjoying the amazing weather and laying in the sun, you can always check out that historic lighthouse or fish off St. Simons Pier. You can also go bird watching or even whale watching. Orange Beach, AL has average temperatures between 59 degrees and 77 degrees Fahrenheit all year long. ©Cavan Images/iStock via Getty Images Located on the Gulf of Mexico, Orange Beach is known for being a top location to do all sorts of water activities. You can lay out under the sun, but just make sure you have sunglasses on. Orange Beach’s sand is 95% quartz so it will sparkle throughout the day and night. Besides some beach fun, you can also check out the buzzing restaurants and the Wharf shopping area. There is also a chance for you to learn a little history at the Orange Beach Indian and Sea Museum.
